page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: The housing consists in part of the 'original' timber, wattle and daub, usually painted white,cream or a shade of pink. There is some thatch, usually covered in wire netting to preserve it against the birds. There is 'Tudor' brick in the area and some of the houses have ovens of about that date. Some are mediaeval halls that have been divided into two storeys and have beams at knee height in bedrooms. There are houses which were built when the railways brought brick to the area. They have Welsh slates. Building is limited to occasional high quality new houses. Much renovation, renewal and extending is done as the area becomes more expensive and select. Two or more cottages are frequently knocked into one, limiting the inexpensive housing stock.
